stem: What is the immediate goal in the treatment of a patient with new-onset Insulin-Dependent Diabetes Mellitus (IDDM) and Diabetic Keto-Acidosis (DKA)?
opt2: Treat the acidosis with sodium bicarbonate
opt3: Restore fluid and electrolyte losses and reverse the catabolic state
opt4: Treat underlying infection which may have precipitated the DKA
disc: The immediate goal in treating DKA is to restore intravascular volume, paying attention to electrolyte losses associated with DKA, especially potassium and phosphate.
